sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Shadow Password Suite contains the chage, chfn, chpasswd, chsh, dpasswd, expiry, faillog, gpasswd, groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, grpck, grpconv, grpunconv, lastlog, login, newgrp, passwd, sg, su, logoutd, mkpasswd, newusers, pwck, pwconv, pwunconv, useradd, userdel, usermod, vigr and vipw programs.

sect3.title: chage
sect3.para: chage changes the number of days between password changes and the date of the last password change.

sect3.title: chfn
sect3.para: chfn changes user full name, office number, office extension, and home phone number information for a user's account.

sect3.title: chpasswd
sect3.para: chpasswd reads a file of user name and password pairs from standard input and uses this information to update a group of existing users.

sect3.title: chsh
sect3.para: chsh changes the user login shell.

sect3.title: dpasswd
sect3.para: dpasswd adds, deletes, and updates dial-up passwords for user login shells.

sect3.title: expiry
sect3.para: Checks and enforces password expiration policy.

sect3.title: faillog
sect3.para: faillog formats the contents of the failure log,/var/log/faillog, and maintains failure counts and limits.

sect3.title: gpasswd
sect3.para: gpasswd is used to administer the /etc/group file

sect3.title: groupadd
sect3.para: The groupadd command creates a new group account using the values specified on the command line and the default values from the system.

sect3.title: groupdel
sect3.para: The groupdel command modifies the system account files, deleting all entries that refer to group.

sect3.title: groupmod
sect3.para: The groupmod command modifies the system account files to reflect the changes that are specified on the command line.

sect3.title: grpck
sect3.para: grpck verifies the integrity of the system authentication information.

sect3.title: grpconv
sect3.para: grpunconv converts to shadow group files from normal group files.

sect3.title: grpunconv
sect3.para: grpunconv converts from shadow group files to normal group files.

sect3.title: lastlog
sect3.para: lastlog formats and prints the contents of the last login log, /var/log/lastlog. The login-name, port, and last login time will be printed.

sect3.title: login
sect3.para: login is used to establish a new session with the system.

sect3.title: newgrp
sect3.para: newgrp is used to change the current group ID during a login session.

sect3.title: passwd
sect3.para: passwd changes passwords for user and group accounts.

sect3.title: sg
sect3.para: sg executes command as a different group ID.

sect3.title: su
sect3.para: Change the effective user id and group id to that of a user. This replaces the su programs that's installed from the Shellutils package.

sect3.title: logoutd
sect3.para: logoutd enforces the login time and port restrictions specified in /etc/porttime.

sect3.title: mkpasswd
sect3.para: mkpasswd reads a file in the format given by the flags and converts it to the corresponding database file format.

sect3.title: newusers
sect3.para: newusers reads a file of user name and clear text password pairs and uses this information to update a group of existing users or to create new users.

sect3.title: pwck
sect3.para: pwck verifies the integrity of the system authentication information.

sect3.title: pwconv
sect3.para: pwconv converts to shadow passwd files from normal passwd files.

sect3.title: pwunconv
sect3.para: pwunconv converts from shadow passwd files to normal files.

sect3.title: useradd
sect3.para: useradd creates a new user or update default new user information.

sect3.title: userdel
sect3.para: userdel modifies the system account files, deleting all entries that refer to a specified login name.

sect3.title: usermod
sect3.para: usermod modifies the system account files to reflect the changes that are specified on the command line.

sect3.title: vipw and vigr
sect3.para: vipw and vigr will edit the files /etc/passwd and /etc/group, respectively. With the -s flag, they will edit the shadow versions of those files, /etc/shadow and /etc/gshadow, respectively.
